name: cinematic studies (2020–21)
description:
cinematic studies, with notes taken from that time 📝

🌞🐦⚖️🍝 - 22/11/2020 | 👧✋🐈🏥 - 24/11/2020 | ⭐💙💸🔫 - 27/11/2020

Take fewer, more careful strokes. Values and edges blend more than you think. There are NO straight lines. Simplify shapes and block them out. Faces curve a lot.

🧬🦽🤯🏫 - 28/11/2020 | 🚘📽️👗🐝 - 29/11/2020 | 👐🙆🌱🦋 - 30/11/2020

Feel free to take a layers-of-depth/figure approach. They're called bokeh lights.

🆕👧🇺🇸🍻 - 07/12/2020 | 🦇♞⚖️🔥 - 23/12/2020 | 🌿💨💃🎶 - 31/12/2020

Spatial relationships – tendency to make things wider than they are. Slow down. Pay attention to subtle shifts re: soft lighting on skin.

🎩⚡🐈🤫 - 31/01/2021 | 🌒🐆🐾🏃 - 03/02/2021 | 🦖🦕🎢🏞️ - 04/02/2021

Pay attention to angle of canvas => face, and be aware of distortion. Start loose.

☀️🍂🌨🌼 - 14/02/2021 | 🕍🎭💎👹 - 08/03/2021 | 🕶️💊☎️🏛️ - 20/12/21

Work 'up to' areas of detail. Get direction of shapes hashed out before detail. Keep practicing!
